verses.roman:
ācambite nṛsiṁhānanda tāhāṅi āilā
duṅhe tāṅre mili' tabe sthāne vasāilā

duṅhe duḥkhī dekhi' tabe kahe nṛsiṁhānanda
'tomā duṅhākāre kene dekhi nirānanda?'

synonyms: ācambite—all of a sudden; nṛsiṁhānanda—Nṛsiṁhānanda; tāhāṅi āilā—came there; duṅhe—Śivānanda and Jagadānanda; tāṅre—him; mili'-meeting; tabe—then; sthāne vasāilā—caused to sit; duṅhe—both; duḥkhī—unhappy; dekhi'-seeing; tabe—then; kahe nṛsiṁhānanda—Nṛsiṁhānanda began to speak; tomā duṅhākāre—both of you; kene—why; dekhi—I see; nirānanda—unhappy.
translation: Suddenly Nṛsiṁhānanda arrived, and Jagadānanda and Śivānanda arranged for him to sit near them. Seeing them both so unhappy, Nṛsiṁhānanda inquired,"Why do I see that you are both despondent?"
